reviews.review_msg: This is an interesting and totally interactive class.  Prof is a disciple of Vygotsky and the whole focus is on Socio cultural learning theory. The classes are very different from standard lectures.  Follow along and an A is guaranteed. Prof is very kind and non-judgemental.
Very good teacher. Keeps the class entertained and uses contemporary references.

I don't get these bad reviews cuz aJay is an absolute sweetheart. This man not only cares about your success in the course, but also about you as an individual. His discussions may sometimes be irrelevant to class material, yet still fun to just listen to. If you show good effort in class/tut, he'll definitely cut you some slack in grading.
He is my favourite TA ever! Made coming to tutorials so fun and interesting! He's great at playing the ukulele and all his ukulele covers are spectacular. Great at keeping students engaged.

I could not stand coming to class. Every single class was just him rambling on and making zero sense. i am really disappointed because I thought this course would be super interesting but I learned nothing. Half the course was just him talking about his music. He is a nice guy but should not be teaching this course.
He talked way too much about music for an education class. You really don't need to go to his lectures for this class. No exams and all assignments are based on readings or documentaries.
really don't think he was suited to teach this class to be honest. seems very distracted and unfocused in what exactly he is teaching.
if all ur students are leaving ur lectures after like 5 minutes, maybe change the way ur lecturing instead of forcing us to stay by implementing an attendance sheet like we're children...
Ajay seems like a nice person, but he is a horrible professor for education. I think he should teach music classes instead.

literally is the worst education class I've ever taken. haven't learned anything during his lectures as all he does is go on multiple tangents on topics completely unrelated to the course. going to the lectures is honestly a joke and if it wasn't for the attendance sheet, you would never find me willingly going to class.

Goes way off topic every week, creates/changes the course as he goes, did nothing then saved everything until the end, makes extremely random discussion posts, takes attendance so your forced to go to this useless class...

literally only talks about music. hasnt taught me anything about the "social issues of education". has no idea how the public school system in BC even works ... spends so much of class time playing random songs and videos

Nice guy but doesn't actually teach anything related to the course. I signed up for social issues in education but it seems like I'm in a music class. Goes way off topic every class. People only show up to lecture for attendance; once people write their names down on the attendance sheet they leave. His class sucks!! Very boring also!!

The course turned from social issues in education to youtube videos of him working out and going on tangents about things unrelated to the course content. Lectures are mainly unrelated to assignments. Forces students to participate in class but cuts people off before they finish talking. The only thing keeping me in this course is my TA.

goes on long unrelated tangents about music, spends class time playing random videos, hardly speaks on social issues of education (what the course is about), changes the course entirely as he goes with little notice, clearly just loves to hear himself, makes us watch videos of him exercising. definitely not qualified to be teaching this course
Great Prof...A recent grad he really understands his students needs.  Oh yeah, his exams are open book.
Best Prof I have ever had...makes class super interesting and is super understanding and helpful...would take a class with him again any day and think everyone should take one with him

Eleonora is a very well-spoken and humble individual, her passion for teaching really shows as she strives to make sure you understand and feel like an individual in her class, rather than a serial number.

Both the Prof and the TA are so nice. They give really good feedback and are always willing to help. The course itself isn't hard at all, very manageable. Honestly one of the most chill classes I've taken

I've never written a review but he deserves it. I'm not finished the course yet but Bing and the TA's genuinely want their students to succeed. All you have to do is go to class (he does do attendance) and go to tuts. Tuts are super easy the first half is literally basically just grounding exercises. Take this class if you want to boost your gpa!

Charles is the most inspiring professor I have yet encountered. His lectures are super engaging because they are mostly filled with story telling about his own personal accomplishments (which are motivational). just show up to lectures and take notes and you will be fine. All of the assignments, project and interview are super simple.

This is my second time in a course with Dr. Bingham, and I have to say that he is the best education prof at SFU hands down. His teaching style is unique and philosophical, but he has been the most influential professor that I have had in terms of shaping my teaching pedagogy. Course grading is fair and materials are interesting!

Charles is an awesome professor, but I'd never pay attention to class. Entire grade is based on weekly logs (super easy), interview (simple), participation (show up to class), and the final project (vague criteria; do whatever you want). Tutorials are more important than the lecture, imo. The class is just a good GPA booster.

One of the best profs I have ever had at SFU. Unlike most profs during COVID-19 remtoe learning, Bing actually made it very accessible to participate and reach out. His lectures are very fun and makes you really think deeply. 5/5 would definitely take another class with him

The BEST prof!! I loved his class and I was so disappointed when everything moved online. If you're interested in education or in becoming an educator, this course is a must! The content was truly inspiring and definitely made me reflect on my past education and think differently about education as a whole. Very valuable content + easy assignments!

Charles is an outstanding prof, one of the best I've ever had! His lectures are so inspiring and he is so charismatic, it makes a lecture go by so quickly because it's so good. I would recommend that everyone have at least 1 course with him, it'll change your perspective on so many things!

Bing is great. So caring and sincere. If you put in the effort, you will get a high mark. But you actually have to go to tutorials and lectures and complete the (easy) assignments. People who dont do well simply didnt try. Highly recommend.

Loved it. Definitely one of the more unique classes I've taken at SFU. Lectures are made interesting with Bing's relevant stories to the material. Light and easy class that really makes you reflect on past experiences to see education in a different perspective!

Such an eye opening, amazing class. It doesn't feel like a typical university lecture class. Tutorials are just as fun. I really enjoyed Charles and the course itself. Thanks for an amazing semster. I'm not even an education major, but I learned alot and will apply it to my life and other courses!!
Amazing course!

He genuinely cares what you have to say. Lecture is a giant tutorial and ta's allow you to participate in whatever way makes you comfortable. Attendance isn't mandatory but it's a slap in Bing's face to people who take this class as just a gpa booster and don't show up because he genuinely gives a hoot. Highly recommend if you want to learn

THIS GUY IS AMAZING! If you want to be an educator take this class I guarantee you will think differently about the system and the way you approach education. He is the type of teacher that reminds me why I do what I do and why I want to teach. Thank you Bing for reminding me! This guy encourages creativity and learning for the sake of learning
AMAZING PROF, i think i grew as a person and student in that class. The assignments allow you to be creative and really connect with the material. 100% would recommend

His lectures are amazing and inspirational.  If you are going to take this course with NO interest in education (and just going to skip classes and slack off) but with a belief that its a GPA Booster, dont. Its such an insult, especially in front of Bing, who really cares about what he teaches. And you wont do great anyway if you miss out.

Bing truly is a legend. Not only is he extremely smart and passionate about the social issues he talks about, but he is a genuinely nice and caring person. If every prof was like Bing, school would be loved by EVERYONE. Will definitely try and take another course with him before I graduate.
Greatest class I've been to so far in my university life. Very good topics discussed and lectures are engaging and full of wisdom.

This class changed me for the better.  Charles, Jason, and Emily are a very effective team and each of them have opened my eyes to social issues.  If you want to have conversations that leave you on the edge of your seat, take this class.  You will have an opportunity to express your opinions and there is a lot of open dialogue.

The course itself teaches one how to be human. In other words, you get a sense of what it is like to be a sensible educator, which is not an easy task per se. The lectures discuss all of the social issues that need to be fixed in our educational system, which makes one think critically, instead of regurgitating facts. Attend all classestutorials!

Bing is incredible. His class should be taken by everyone, regardless of your faculty. The course is not "easy" but it makes you think. You'll do extremely well if you engage in the course. Inspiring! He's extremely respectful of the students and will change your life - I promise (for the better too!)
Great lecture and tutorials - easy to get a good grade as long as you do the readings and put in a lot of effort. It's more about "doing" than "memorizing".

This class has been one of the most amazing experience in my educational life. Dr.Bingham is the most open-minded, interesting, inspiring professor I've met in a long time (if not ever!). I now aspire to bring change in my own education and the education of others.
MUST TAKE THIS CLASS WITH BING! SUPER GOOD PROF

The lecture and tutorials are really inspiring. Lectures are participation based, which is awesome! The projects are fun and challenging, although the class is really easy. But since it's easy and interesting, it's really worth it. The TAs know when you're not putting in the effort, so try and enjoy yourself a bit!
REALLY GOOD PROF. TAKE HIS CLASS.
Really enjoyed the discussions in this class! Great prof-- really open and down to earth. :)

Honestly: take this class. If you're an educ major or otherwise, it will blow your mind. I wasn't expecting much from this class but it's changed my outlook on everything education related. Bing is an amazing prof. His passion for education and shifting attitudes is infectious. Out of 4 years of courses, only this one will stick with me.

A very enlightening class. Bing is great. Super passionate. His views can be very narrow minded on some topics. He talked A LOT about HIS opinion. I would have appreciated perspectives from the rest of the world as well. But all in all, it was a great class.

Hand down best prof at SFU. Lectures were always interesting and Bing is clearly passionate about education. I would highly recommend not only to education students but anyone who wants to learn a different approach to our education system.

Charles is a really nice prof and willing to help his students when they have problems. Lectures are really interesting and allow us to have a better understanding of the global education system. Assignments are very broad but it allows us to do more exploration and gain more knowledge from it. Awesome class and prof!

A great class for anyone interested in going into the field of education. Very interesting topics relevant to education today. Discussion and questions always encouraged in lectures. Overall, a class that I thoroughly enjoyed
Very nice prof. Friendly. Course is very interesting for both people interested in teaching and social issues in general
Amazing. best prof ever.
Was an awesome prof. very funny, very interested in his students. His stories and teaching style is very invigorating and unique
Great class, truly was not expecting much from this class but it really blew me away. Would take it again if I could. Recommended!
One of the best teacher's I have ever had.

A MUST take class!! This class opens my mind and the way about education system and social issues. Everything in this class is related to our everyday life. It will help your life alot in the future. He is my #1 favorite teacher in my 4 yrs school. Jason is my TA and he is the BEST I've ever had!! Easiest A I've got.

Very interesting professor! The idea of the majority of the class being marked on a single project was daunting at first, but incredibly worthwhile in the end. He was clear during lectures and kept them interesting with guests and audio/visual components. Definitely learned a lot in this class!

Charles is a phenomenal prof. The material was interesting and thought provoking. He was very thorough answering questions and shared many of his personal experiences to give examples. Overall an excellenT prof. I highly recommend taking his social issues class!!
Fun, interesting, easy class

Very passionate prof. and very easy marker. Has a very wide range of experiences teaching and is very insightful. Definitely recommend this class if you are planning on going into teaching. Plus it wont hurt your GPA as long as you do all of your assignments

I really cant take just 350 words to explain how AMAZING Charles was. He really inspired me to become the best teacher I can be and opened my eyes about a lot of social issues going on today. He is BY FAR my favourite prof in my three years here. I will DEFINATELY crash his 240 class in the fall! So refreshing to see a prof as passionate as him! =D

this teacher is the worst.  I had him for EDUC 240 and PDP.  He is very unclear and unorganized.   Often he didn't even show up to teach us and his excuse was that he just forgot.  He also yelled at one of the students for asking a simple question-he was totally unprofessional.

The class is indeed easy and a good gpa booster, however the class was not a joke. Charles wakes you up! The assignments are straight forward. He is one of the best profs I have ever had, he has some important things to make public. He is very respected and highly recommended. Not only will you get a good mark, but you will learn.

I literally found this class a joke. Although there were a lot of interesting points brought about in lecture, it was often too laid back for my liking. The assignments and papers with without guidelines. If you need to increase your GPA definately take this. You won't have to put in much work except some reading, two short assignments and a paper.

Easiest A in history, awesome GPA booster, but lectures are pointless, and he doesn't give breaks for some reason. Lecture topics seem somewhat aimless and you never know what to take notes on. There are no tests and the papers and presentation are very simple. Tutorials were good, TA's are nice and mark easy.

One of my favourite classes/profs ever. Lectures are amazing - on the first day, the entire lecture was centred around a final exam instructions sheet he just *found* there and was extremely interesting. Great method for paper topics - your choice. Really enlightened me about what a teacher should be. Encourages interactivity during lecture.

Cares about students a lot. Understands the youth. Lectures are OUTSTANDING, you get drawn in by his teaching performance despite having a 8:30class. Uses what he teaches to benefit future generations.

I LOVED this course and this prof. Take a course with him, you will not regret it. I connects what he talks about with real world experiences. He actually *talks* with his students(a new idea,I know). He knows his stuff and is very passionate about what he teaches. LOVE HIM
